title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For sketching either energy curve with a reasonably correct shape between x = -D and x = 0, with zero and maximum values at the correct locations

1 point is earned: For sketching two curves from x = -D to x = 0 with shapes and values such that the total energy is constant (even if the curves are incorrect)

1 point is earned: For sketching potential energy equal to zero from x = 0 to x = 3D

1 point is earned: For sketching kinetic energy as a linear function from its maximum value at x = 0 to zero at x = 3D

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
(i)

1 point is earned: For identifying that the student is correct that the block will have more energy when it leaves the spring

(ii)

1 point is earned: For identifying that the student is incorrect about the new final position of the block because the spring’s energy does not scale linearly with its compression
descriptions:

(i)

1 point is earned: For identifying that the student is correct that the block will have more energy when it leaves the spring

(ii)

1 point is earned: For identifying that the student is incorrect about the new final position of the block because the spring’s energy does not scale linearly with its compression

The student response earns all of the following points:

(ii)

1 point is earned: For identifying that the student is incorrect about the new final position of the block because the spring’s energy does not scale linearly with its compression

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For indicating that the final energy in the spring (which becomes the mechanical energy of the block as it reaches the rough track) is four times the original energy in the spring

1 point is earned: For indicating that the frictional force remains the same

1 point is earned: For equating the initial energy in the spring to an expression that shows that the energy dissipated by friction is proportional to the distance the block slides down the rough track

Example:

U 1 = 1 2 k D 2 and, U 2 = 1 2 k ( 2D ) 2 ,so, U 2 =4 U 1 W 1 =μmg( 3D )and, W 2 =μmgΔ x 2 W 1 = U 1 and, W 2 = U 2 =4 U 1 =4 W 1 μmgΔ x 2 =4( μmg( 3D ) ) Δ x 2 =4( 3D )=12D MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGvb WaaSbaaSqaaiaaigdaaeqaaOGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGa aGOmaaaacaWGRbGaamiramaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiaadggaca WGUbGaamizaiaacYcacaWGvbWaaSbaaSqaaiaaikdaaeqaaOGaeyyp a0ZaaSaaaeaacaaIXaaabaGaaGOmaaaacaWGRbWaaeWaaeaacaaIYa GaamiraaGaayjkaiaawMcaamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiaacYca caWGZbGaam4BaiaacYcacaWGvbWaaSbaaSqaaiaaikdaaeqaaOGaey ypa0JaaGinaiaadwfadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaakeaacaWGxbWa aSbaaSqaaiaaigdaaeqaaOGaeyypa0JaeqiVd0MaamyBaiaadEgada qadaqaaiaaiodacaWGebaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaamyyaiaad6gacaWG KbGaaiilaiaadEfadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcqaH8o qBcaWGTbGaam4zaiabfs5aejaadIhadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaaa keaacaWGxbWaaSbaaSqaaiaaigdaaeqaaOGaeyypa0JaamyvamaaBa aaleaacaaIXaaabeaakiaadggacaWGUbGaamizaiaacYcacaWGxbWa aSbaaSqaaiaaikdaaeqaaOGaeyypa0JaamyvamaaBaaaleaacaaIYa aabeaakiabg2da9iaaisdacaWGvbWaaSbaaSqaaiaaigdaaeqaaOGa eyypa0JaaGinaiaadEfadaWgaaWcbaGaaGymaaqabaaakeaacqaH8o qBcaWGTbGaam4zaiabfs5aejaadIhadaWgaaWcbaGaaGOmaaqabaGc cqGH9aqpcaaI0aWaaeWaaeaacqaH8oqBcaWGTbGaam4zamaabmaaba GaaG4maiaadseaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaeaacqqH uoarcaWG4bWaaSbaaSqaaiaaikdaaeqaaOGaeyypa0JaaGinamaabm aabaGaaG4maiaadseaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGaaGOm aiaadseaaaaa@9923@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For indicating that the student’s correct reasoning that the block has more energy in the second situation is expressed by the calculations comparing the initial energy in the spring

1 point is earned: For indicating that the student’s correct reasoning that the block will slide farther is expressed by an equation that indicates that the work done by friction to stop the block in the second situation is some factor greater than the work done in the first situation

1 point is earned: For indicating that the student’s incorrect reasoning that energy scales linearly with the spring’s compression is corrected by the expression for the initial energy of the spring
descriptions:

1 point is earned: For indicating that the student’s incorrect reasoning that energy scales linearly with the spring’s compression is corrected by the expression for the initial energy of the spring
